column4: I have an ATI accelerated graphics driver, should I use vesa then?
As I can see i i have a M56P [Radeon Mobility X1600] should I then use vesa as my graphic?
I wish to have higher resolution
!resolution
vesa or fglrx are your only choices
then you need fglrx
I think I have fglrx right now
grep Driver /etc/X11/xorg.conf
But I know from before I used vesa, and like max I can have right now is 1400x900 or atleast near those numbers.
Yeah it's fglrx
Any idea if I can somehow get higher resolution?
yes it can do higher. higher than vesa for sure
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
I'm to new to reconfigure that myself.
I've tried it once or twice, and once it ended up with me having to reinstall my computer :;p
just backup your /etc/X11/xorg.conf
How do I backup and, restore to the backup?
I'm quite new to ubuntu, and linux
by copying the file to somewhere else and copying back if needed
Ok, but how do I import it later?
Should I copy it via the terminal? Cause that I do not know how to do
yes. man cp
cp --backupp[/etc/X11/xorg.conf] ?
Any idea about what I just said? :S
